page.title: 04AYMESTREY SCHOOL.
page.content: Aymestrey school is 76 years old. It was built in 1909 and was previously called Crown East Park. It was sold in 1967 for Â£10,000.It is a 50 bedroomed house with 40 acres of land which overlooks the Malverns.It is mostly woodland with lakes and a cricket pavilion. There are about 10 children in a class,and 5 classes which makes a total of about 50 children in the school.The staff consists of the headmaster and his wife,2 other full time teachers,3 part time teachers & 3 music teachers. The school caters for children of 8 to 13 years.The school day is 8.50am to 5.30pm in summer & 8.50am to 6.00pm in winter.The uniform is green & grey.A famous old boy,Oliver Philpott escaped with 2 or 3 others from prisoner of war camps in Germany.
